Income Statement

The income statement shows a company's profitability and performance over a given period of time. The income statement can also be refered to as the statement of operations or the profit & loss statement.

The income statement lists out the company's temporary accounts (revenues & expenses) and their associated balances prior to being closed out for the period to retained earnings.

The income statement provides answers to the following questions:

  • How large are the company's operations?
  • How does the company generate revenue?
  • How much net income did the company earn during the period?
  • How profitable is the company's core business?
  • How much overhead did the company incur during the period?
  • How much does the company spend servicing debts?
  • How did the company perform relative to previous periods?
